paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The c.7805G > C variation in the BRCA2 gene, leading to exon 16 skipping, was detected with a junction between exon 15 and exon 17 in ovarian and salpingian tissue samples from patient 20X0175.

functional_data.summary: The variant leads to exon skipping, which may affect protein function.

variants.evidence_level: likely pathogenic based on functional impact
variants.additional_notes: This variant has not been previously described.
key_quotes: The c.7805G > C variation in the BRCA2 gene, leading to exon 16 skipping, was detected with a junction between exon 15 and exon 17 in ovarian and salpingian tissue samples from patient 20X0175.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 c.67+3A > G variation (patient 20X0140), leading to exon 2 skipping, was found thanks to an abnormal junction of exons 1 to 3.

functional_data.summary: The variant leads to exon skipping, which may affect protein function.

variants.evidence_level: likely pathogenic based on functional impact
variants.additional_notes: This skipping of exons 2 and 3 has never been described before.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 c.67+3A > G variation (patient 20X0140), leading to exon 2 skipping, was found thanks to an abnormal junction of exons 1 to 3.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
